definitions.definition: the resting state in which the body is not active and the mind is unconscious:
examples: I must get some sleep - I'm exhausted.
I couldn't get to sleep at all last night I was so worried.
UK You must be tired after all that driving - why don't you have a little sleep?

definitions.definition: to be in the state of rest when your eyes are closed, your body is not active, and your mind is unconscious:
examples: I couldn't sleep because of all the noise next door.

definitions.definition: If a vehicle, tent, etc. sleeps a particular number of people, it provides enough space or beds for that number of people to be able to sleep in it:

examples: I went to bed early and slept like a log.

definitions.definition: to delay making a decision about something important until the next day so that you have time to consider it carefully:
examples: Can I sleep on it, and tell you my decision tomorrow?

definitions.definition: to sleep outside because you have no home and no money:
examples: Hundreds of kids are sleeping rough on the streets of the capital.
